net.sf.mmm.util.gwt.api

Class JavaScriptUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.mmm.util.gwt.api.JavaScriptUtil

  • public class JavaScriptUtil
extends Object
    This class holds a collection of utility functions for GWT (Google Web Toolkit) using JSNI (JavaScript Native Interface).
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)
    See Also:
    getInstance()

        Returns:

      • setCustomValidity

        public boolean setCustomValidity(com.google.gwt.dom.client.Element inputElement,
                                 String message)
        This method sets the custom validation message of the given input Element. The Browser needs to support HTML5 for this feature.
        Parameters:
        inputElement - is the input Element that has been validated.
        message - - the empty string to mark as valid, the validation failure message otherwise.
        Returns:
        true if the browser supports custom validity and it has been set, false otherwise.

      • createInputElement

        public com.google.gwt.dom.client.InputElement createInputElement(String type)
        Creates an InputElement of a custom type. Only used while GWT does NOT directly provide a way to create HTML5 input elements.
        Parameters:
        type - is the requested type (e.g. "range", "date", etc.).
        Returns:
        the requested InputElement of the given type.

      • setInputElementType

        private void setInputElementType(com.google.gwt.dom.client.InputElement inputElement,
                                 String type)
        This method sets the type of an InputElement.
        Parameters:
        inputElement - is the input InputElement.
        type - is the new type to set.

        public Object clone(Object template)
        This method creates a clone of the given template.
        Parameters:
        template - is the object to clone.
        Returns:
        the cloned object.

        public Object newInstance(Object template)
        This method creates a new instance of the given template.
        Parameters:
        template - is the object create a new instance of.
        Returns:
        the new instance.

      • getResponseAsBlob

        public JsBlob getResponseAsBlob(com.google.gwt.xhr.client.XMLHttpRequest xhr)
        This method gets the response of the given XMLHttpRequest as JsBlob.
        Parameters:
        xhr - is the XMLHttpRequest that has already been loaded.
        Returns:
        the response as a JsBlob.

      • getFileList

        public JsFileList getFileList(com.google.gwt.user.client.Event event)
        This method gets the JsFileList for a given Event. E.g. if files are dragged onto some element in the browser or in case of an Event (e.g. of ) of a file input you can receive the JsFileList here.
        Parameters:
        event - is the Event.
        Returns:
        the JsFileList or null if no files are available.

      • getBlobUrl

        public String getBlobUrl(JsBlob blob)
        This method creates the URL pointing to a JsBlob. Such URL is starting with the "blob:" scheme and is only valid within the current JS context.
        Parameters:
        blob - is the JsBlob.
        Returns:
        the new instance.

      • openBlob

        public void openBlob(JsBlob blob)
        This method opens a given JsBlob. The browser will show a regular popup to open the file or save it to the local disc. Depending on its mimetype the browser might already open the file immediately in a new window.
        Parameters:
        blob - is the JsBlob.

      • getComputedStyle

        public JsCssStyleDeclaration getComputedStyle(com.google.gwt.dom.client.Element element)
        This method gets the computed style of the given Element.
        ATTENTION:
        Do not get confused by the name of this method. It will only "calculate" the CSS rules but return these properties unmodified. So if you are looking for a way to get the actual calculated width or height of an Element in pixels (rather than something like "50%") just use Element.getOffsetWidth() or Element.getOffsetHeight() instead.
        Parameters:
        element - is the Element to compute the style of.
        Returns:
        the computed style.

      • getSelection

        public JsSelection getSelection()
        This method gets the JsSelection of the browser Window.
        Returns:
        the corresponding JsSelection.

      • getSelection

        public JsSelection getSelection(com.google.gwt.dom.client.Element iframe)
        This method gets the JsSelection of the given <iframe> Element. The given iframe needs to be loaded when calling this method. Use onLoadFrame(Element, Runnable) to ensure.
        Parameters:
        iframe - is the <iframe> Element.
        Returns:
        the corresponding JsSelection.

      • isFocusable

        public boolean isFocusable(com.google.gwt.dom.client.Element element,
                           boolean tabable)
        Determines if the given Element is focusable or tab-able.
        Parameters:
        element - is the Element to check.
        tabable - - true if the check should only consider tab-able Elements (so if tabindex is negative, the result is false), false otherwise.
        Returns:
        true if focusable/tab-able, false otherwise.

      • getFocusedElement

        public com.google.gwt.dom.client.Element getFocusedElement()
        Returns:
        the Element that is currently focused or null if focus is outside the current document.

      • getFocusable

        public com.google.gwt.dom.client.Element getFocusable(com.google.gwt.dom.client.Element element,
                                                      boolean tabable,
                                                      boolean last)
        Get the first/last focusable or tab-able (child) Element.
        Parameters:
        element - is the Element to scan recursively.
        tabable - - true if the check should only consider tab-able Elements (so if tabindex is negative, the result is false), false otherwise.
        last - - true if the last focusable/tab-able element shall be returned, false for the last focusable/tab-able element.
        Returns:
        the first/last focusable or tab-able Element or null if none exists.

      • getFrameDocument

        public com.google.gwt.dom.client.Document getFrameDocument(com.google.gwt.dom.client.Element iframe)
        This method gets the Document of a given <iframe> Element. The given iframe needs to be loaded when calling this method. Use onLoadFrame(Element, Runnable) to ensure.
        Parameters:
        iframe - is the <iframe> Element.
        Returns:
        the corresponding Document.

      • onLoadFrame

        public void onLoadFrame(com.google.gwt.dom.client.Element iframe,
                        Runnable callback)
        This method executes the given callback when the given iframe is loaded.
        Parameters:
        iframe - is the <iframe> Element.
        callback - is the callback to execute.

      • getFonts

        private com.google.gwt.core.client.JsArrayString getFonts()
        Returns:
        an array with the sorted names of the fonts installed.
